msDesc.head: Thomas Aquinas, Summae theologicae pars prima; etc.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 1r. Tabula principalium questionum prime partis summe patris thome de Aquino predicatoris. De capitula prima omnium encium .q. 44
msItem.explicit: Fol. 1v. Vj... De iusticia et misericordia dei q. 71.
msItem.title: The principal quaestiones of item 3 below, in alphabetical order.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 2v. Quescio prima. De ipsa theologica doctrina
msItem.explicit: Fol. 4v. 584. An semen quod est principum humane generationis sit de superfiuo alimenti.
msItem.title: The tituli of the quaestiones of item 3 below, in numerical order, 1-584.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 5r. Quia catholice ueritatis doctor non solum prouectos... quod materia patietur. Et ut intentio nostra
msItem.explicit: Fol. 163rb. Talis enim partus decebat eum qui est super omnia benedictus in secula. Amen.
msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: Summa theologica, pars 1

listBibl.bibl: F. Stegmüller, Repertorium commentariorum in Sententias Petri Lombardi, 2 vols. (Würzburg, 1947), 847, q.v. also for early editions.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 164r. Quia in quolibet opere finis ultimus est primum in intentione in principio huius operis de fine erit questio. Utrum videlicet doctrina sacre speculativa sit an practica
msItem.explicit: Fol. 165rb. et quod hec est uita eterna. dixit dominus. in psalmo. Longitudine di. re. e. et os. il. sa. m. etc.
msItem.title: Not identified.

msItem.incipit: Fol. 165rb. Utrum theologia sit scientia quod non. sen. j
msItem.explicit: Fol. 170v. vna sola pars melioretur. et anima non quia sic corrumperetur ordo. sed omnes simul.
msItem.title: Concordances to Aquinas In sententias

listBibl.bibl: The opening words are at 1 SN ds qu 1 ar 3b, Opera omnia, i (Stuttgart, 1980), 3/1-2.

msItem.rubric: Fol. 170va. Determinatio quorundam articulorum facta per Stephanum templarii episcopum parisiensem et uniuersitatem magistrorum.
msItem.incipit: Uniuersis litteras inspecturis. Stephanus permissione diuina parisiensis ecclesie minister indignus. Salutem In uirginis filio gloriosi. Magnarum et grauium personarum crebra
msItem.explicit: Fol. 172va. quod nusquam sunt secundum substantiam.
msItem.author: Étienne Tempier
msItem.title: Condamnatio 219 propositionum, 7 Martii 1277

listBibl.bibl: Pr. H. Denifle and A. Chatelain, Chartularium Universitatis Parisiensis, i (Paris, 1889), 543¬55, no. 473.
See E. Hisette, 'Enquete sur les 219 articles condamnes a Paris le 7 mars 1277', Philosophie médiévale, 22 (1977);
also Glorieux, Rép., no. 177, and references.

msItem.rubric: Fol. 172va. Diuersimode facia afratre Thoma in diuersis stint hec.
msItem.incipit: In primis quedam circa diuinam naturam
msItem.title: Concordantia sancti Thomae

listBibl.bibl: Ed. R.-A. Gauthier, 'Les "Articuli" in quibus frater Thomas melius in Summa quam in Scriptis', RTAM 19 (1952), 271-326, the text of the Primum supplementum only, edn. 315-26. Our manuscript, Gauthier's a, is one of a group of twenty-six, plus three fragments, of a different nature from the twelve in the group on which his edition is based. He notes that this is one of only two manuscripts in which the Primum supplementum is found in its pure state.

msItem.explicit: Fol. 177vb. in aliquo placet deo. in quo alius non placet. scilicet in passione.
msItem.author: Thomas de Sutton
msItem.title: De concordantiis

listBibl.bibl: Ed. P. Mandonnet, S. Thomae Aquinatis opuscula omida, v: Opuscula spuuia (Paris, 1927), 444-74;
Stegmüller, Sent. 867, q.v. also for earlier editions;

supportDesc.collation: Collation; 14 212 312 (wants 7) 412 (wants 1) 5-1012 1112 (wants 6, 7) 12-1412 158 (wants 8, ?blank) 1614. There are various ad hoc quire signatures. Quires 2 and 4 have neat red vertical strokes on leaves 1-6 of each quire: in quire 4 these are stroked through horizontally. Quire 3 has traces of four horizontal red strokes. Quire 13 (fols.133-44) has capital roman figures written in hardpoint on the first six leaves; these have a stroke over but not under them and a small upwards-tilted stroke runs away from them on the right side. The first leaf has also a vertical blue stroke. Quire 16 (fols. 164-77) has neat blue vertical strokes on the first seven leaves with a small horizontal dash to the right, through the last vertical. The only evidence of the use of catchwords is a tiny trace of one on fol. 144v.

layoutDesc.layout:
Written in two columns, each
258 75 50 lines. Only pricking for verticals is visible. Ruled in crayon. Folded FSOS.

handDesc.handNote: A good gothic scholastic bookhand, more rotunda than consistently quadrata or semiquadrata. One scribe. Punctuation is by low point.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine historiated illuminated initial on fol. 5r, a Cistercian monk adoring Christ crucified.
Good bar border on same page and good blue lombards flourished red throughout.
Rubrics and red and blue paraphs throughout.

At the bottom of the last leaves of quires 5, 7-14, i.e. fols. 50v, v, 86v, 98v, 110v, 120v, 132v, 144v, 156v, between the vertical lines defining the space between the columns, are cursive roman figures in crayon. They give totals that are mostly between 40 and 50 and indicate the number of decorated initials. Alexander and Temple, no. 723, 'French' (pl. XLII repr. initial fol. 5r).

binding.p: Sewn on seven double bands between millboards covered with 17th-century brown calf, plain except for triple blind fillet round edges. Front pastedowns are sig. c7v/4r and back pastedowns are sig. c6v/5v from a copy of Johann Reuchlin, Vocabularius breviloquus, printed by Johann Amerbach at Basel. Our leaves do not exactly match any of the known editions, of 1478, 1480, 1481, and 1482.

history.provenance:
Even if made in France, the book seems to have been in the hands of an English reader early in s. xiv, judging by marginalia in more than one anglicana hand, e.g. on fols. 510v, 850r. On fol. 177v is the ex libris of the Cistercian abbey of Vaudey, Lincolnshire, Liber beate Marie de Walle dei in an ugly ornamental script perhaps of s. xv/xvi. On fol. iir is Narcissus Luttrell: His Book 1677: on the College's acquisition of his books see under MS 17 above. On fol. iiir is a title, Liber De Deo& beata Virgine Maria, in his hand.
All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, on the front pastedown, v.v.1.6 (deleted), M.S. 21 (figure added), L.R. r.e.6 (pencil), 102 (pencil), and bookplate no. 10; on fol. ir are 16 (pencil) and 1.5 (pencil).

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.
